channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024100618
item.description:
Report E-2024100618

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-27T18:24:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 10, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon jugs of UN3266 were damaged during loading and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged jugs were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100623
item.description:
Report E-2024100623

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-27T18:24:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 10, 2024, five (5) 5-gallon pails of UN3266 were damaged in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents, soda ash, and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024101206
item.description:
Report X-2024101206

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: SAVANNAH
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THe shipment was discovered leaking in the drivers van during offload. The package was picked up by FedEx and found leaking when the vehicle arrived at the station. Absorbent pads and vermiculite were used to contain and clean up the spill. No other packages were affected. The package contained 4 metal cans in a fiberboard box surrounded in bubble wrap, and overpacked. 3 metal cans were leaking from the top. The remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024100455
item.description:
Report E-2024100455

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-16
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver was in the process of delivering Aromatic Petroleum Distillates into the customer's storage tank. The driver inadvertently disconnected a delivery hose that was still under pressure. This allowed approximately 60 gallons of product to be released. Customer personnel handled the remediation. A small amount of product was able to spray onto the driver and resulted in them seeking medical treatment.
